name: Lanson Place Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lanson Place has been a lovely quiet hotel to stay in during our first visit to Hong Kong. The staff are friendly, helpful and unobtrusive. It's a quiet place to return to after busy days of shopping and sightseeing. It is so close to the MTR which makes travelling around Hong Kong so easy. Lanson Place seems to be used mostly by business travellers but we enjoyed our stay very much. The free wi-fi and the welcome pack are a bonus.
reviews.title: Tranquil Escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: I can only confirm what others have written: great hotel!
reviews.title: Great hotel
Great Hotel and Location
reviews.text: Upon arrival at Hong Kong airport, we took the Airport Hotel Shuttle (HK $ 140 for the first person, HK $ 80 for the second person) that left within 10 minutes. Within one hour we reached the hotel. We got an upgrade to a Deluxe room. What an excellent room! Big, comfortable bed and nice bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast was fine, but a bit strange to have to eat on couches and not have a real dining room with tables.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The location is good. Close to shopping malls and public transportation.
reviews.title: Excellent shopping location

likes.disliked: — I liked everything about this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: It's the best address for those keen to put up in the viscinity of Causeway Bay.
reviews.title: Just Fabulous - possibly the best (Value for Money) address in HK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is a Boutique property with immaculate cleanliess, decor and grandeur. This is one of the very rare hotels providing convenience of kitchenette for guests with specific dietary needs / choices. Continental breakfast is pretty well spread out and comes cmplimentary with almost all room categories. Hotel fully wi-fi enabled. THe check-in and concierge desks are as warm as anyone would expect them to be Also, the layout of rooms and bathrooms is done with a high taste.
reviews.title: excellent boutique hotel
Quiet Sancturay in the Heart of the F&B and shopping districts
reviews.text: I would certainly recommend this place to travellers - business or leisure and with families and children too. Yes, this will be my address in HongKong henceforth.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this hotel!! Being members of Small Luxury Hotels of the World we were upgraded to a large room with fantastic facilities. The small kichen is a bonus. Loved the views and decor as well. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Yes the bathroom is a little open but the shower was fantastic, big with great pressure. Very comfortable bed and pillow, although had to request a top sheet, small gripe though. Our room was opposite the lift, but we never heard a thing, other than people talking occasionaly. It is in a great location, close to the metro which is so easy to use. The gym is also excellent, well equiped etc. Breakfast was reasonable, with seating sometimes an issue and lots of noisy children when we were there. Would definetely return.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been visiting Hong Kong for several years both for business and leisure. I have found good hotels very expensive. Lanson PLace is a true gem that I would never have found had it not been for my many visits to Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Great service and well designed

likes.disliked: — some of the business guests are brash and unpleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: ok it was in the shopping area ,it is very calm and quiet i liked the room where you have breakfast ,it had lovely books to read but hong kong is aplace where you have no time to read you want to get out and about ,,,,,,there is no BUZZ about the place nice rooms very pleasant staff also stayed in the intercontinental kowloon amazing ,,,and the four seasons on the island coming a close second but more of a business hotel,,,loved all of hong kong
reviews.title: very nice but.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 6 nights at Lanson Place, and we both enjoyed the excellent service we received from the staff, in particular the Concierge. There was always a doorman to open the doors for us when we entered or left the hotel. Always friendly, always professional. As for the room, it was a reasonable size, for Hong Kong. Decor is contemporary and bright. I loved the iHome system which allowed us to listen to the Ipod as we relaxed. The in room wireless internet was great so I could catch up with all my emails on my iphone. For those without a mobile internet device, there was also a couple of computers for use in the Business Centre on the first floor, free of charge. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone stopping in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Great personalised service

likes.disliked: — Open view of the bathroom and toilet from the bedroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Lanson Place is a superb choice to stay in Hong Kong. The hotel is ideally located less than 5 minutes walk to the MRT/ Subway. The hotel facilities are top notch. The rooms are spacious, very comfortable, modern, well decorated. Bathrooms are nice as well. ( i was on the 26 floor and the view was amazing).
reviews.title: Terrific Choice! Excellent Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The staff is a huge plus there. They are very helpful, attentive and professional. The folks at the front desk and at the reception go above and beyond to make sure you are satisfy and taken care of.
reviews.title: Amazing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can safely say that in terms of staff and services, Lanson is definitely one of the best places I have ever been.
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights whilst traveling on our honeymoon and got upgraded to a Kingbed Deluxe room. The location of the hotel is excellent for Causeway Bay yet still very quiet. We were on the 15th floor and the room was immaculately tidy and quiet. Admittedly it wasn't the biggest room we had ever been to, but still large enough and with the separate bed room and lounge/kitchen area it felt larger. The bathroom was also very high-design, but please note the glass doors and walls so best to stay there with your better half rather than sharing with a friend...
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in Causeway Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Also, one element that could be improved is the ledge between bathroom and the room which led to a few painful trips as it is fairly high, but this is just a minor point.
reviews.title: great place. quiet comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The breakfast was tasty and varied and the level of service throughout was immaculate. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again when in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the Lanson

likes.liked: — Very comfortable and clean quality rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i love this hotel. granted it has few of the whistle and bells such as a gym, pool or restaurants..but all of that is just right outside. Lanson Place is very lovely..the rooms are huge and sexy. (some of them are smaller..but many are the size of an small one room apartment. The staff is excellent and the location is quiet and easy. I prefer the island to kowloon. the causeway bay metro is just a five minit walk away and there are lots of restaurants and shops down the street. give it a try. you wont be sorry.
reviews.title: Our new home in HK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed in the most basic room for three nights in August. The room was in an excellent condition, housekeeping does a great job of making everything look good, a number of thoughtful features can be found and the service is warm, sincere and non-intrusive.
reviews.title: Love the Murano Room and The Service

likes.liked: — The cleanliness of the room, the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lanson Place Hotel makes you feel at home (with the service of a hotel on top, and here the service is fabulous). Thanks to an upgrade our room was spacious and on the 26th floor, offering a nice view over Causeway Bay. The glass bathroom may not be everybody's cup of tea but apart from that the room was perfect (good bed, generous storage space, WiFi, TVs, DVD players, kitchenette, desk, couch). Altoghether this hotel is much better than many five stars I have been in. We also liked the location which is inbetween luxury shopping and Jardine's Bazaar and very close to the centre by MTR. Breakfast is only "light continental" but still quite nice. When back in Hong Kong, we will clearly chose the Lanson Place Hotel again.
reviews.title: Better Than Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is the second time I have stayed in this hotel. It was again excellent: wonderful service, very good rooms, incredibly comfortable beds, very accommodating staff. The location is excellent, just three minutes on foot to Causeway Bay MTR. Just one gripe: breakfast is not complimentary any longer - it costs $100 (plus 10% tax). However, this is a small point and will not deter me from staying here again next time I am in Hong Kong. Very highly recommended!
reviews.title: Excellent - again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely, spotless, albeit slightly small, room. Charming staff. Excellent breakfast. Suspect it is only 4* because it lacks some facilities - those it offers are truly 5* and the location (3 stops on the MRT from Central) is probably what makes it so reasonable.
reviews.title: A delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A delightful stay.
reviews.title: Individual in it's appeal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stay in HK quite often and always look for somewhere a little different from before. The Lanson is a member of the SLH Group and once you make it to your room, you can tell it qualifies on size straight away. The staff however are very polite and helpful and the rooms whilst small are nicely decorated with a somewhat open approach to the bathrooms in that their separated from the living area by glass and not all that private. That being said, the hotel is a 10 min walk from Times Square and the metro, good value by HK standards and tastefully decorated with excellent staff - so if you looking for somewhere a little less frenetic than the larger hotels, this might be the place for you. One word of warning however - the soundproofing between rooms could do with beefing up as we were disturbed on our first night by fellow guest with little regard for those aorund them until we knocked on their door at 2.00am to get them to turn their TV down.
reviews.title: Hard to beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel itself is more like a upmarket serviced apartments.
reviews.title: Trendy property, good service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: I arrived at around 8am, and was given a early check-in plus an upgrade at the same time, the service simply cannot be faulted.
reviews.title: Excellent place...

likes.disliked: — Nothing... mmm maybe expensive business cost such things as photocopy and stuff.. but free internet ..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: A few previous comments mentioned the "unknown brand" of LCD tv, which wasn't a big issue to be, but the remote wasn't very sensitive.
reviews.title: Eclectic style hotel

likes.liked: — Location, style, room, view and hotel facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower is great, but there's not tub.
reviews.title: Great place, super design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The sound proofing is quite good as well, I stayed at a room right opposite the lifts, and couldn't hear a thing (apart from the odd "ding" noise) day or night.
reviews.title: Great hotel without all the fuss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lanson Place is a great place to stay in middle of Causeway Bay, within a stone's throw from Jardine's Bazaar, a street lined with small local restaurants, which provide convenient food for any meal of the day.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay at Lanson Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was above average for Hong Kong, a city not know for its smiles. Superior Room was comfortable and clean, although kitchenette is not really necessary. Wifi provided at a charge. As other reviewers noted, bathrooms are a bit translucent and oddly designed but for a couple or individual stay it is fine. Concierge gave good recommendations when asked, and always had a map ready to be starred.
reviews.title: A peaceful oasis in Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Easy walking distance to Causeway Bay shops and MTR. However, the streets are small, so not recommended for families with young children / strollers etc. Amenities are quite simple: A small business center and gym, no pool, but we did not feel the need for any extra amenities.
reviews.title: Nice Boutique Hotel in Causeway Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a very pleasant comfortable stay in HK, when considering what you get for the price.
reviews.title: Good Kitchenette

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lanson Place Hotel is located in the thick of things in Causeway Bay in Hong Kong, but when you enter the hotel, all that is left behind. The hotel is quiet and peaceful. The library, up one floor from the concierge, has a selection of books and comfy chairs. The rooms are immaculate, with a great view, a very comfortable bed and a modern bathroom. The staff is very helpful and informative. There is also a very nice little work-out room. If you like a contemporary boutique hotel, you will love Lanson Place.
reviews.title: unsurpassed personal service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lanson Place hotel is a great find. We were upgraded to a beautiful one suite. The suites are beautifully furnished with lovely views of the city and an adjoining stadium and hill. Great beds. A generous workspace and a sofa setting with a dvd player along with a kitchenette could well make you stay there as long as you want! The breakfast though is disappointing. There is no restaurant as such but the lobby is very contemporary and a nice place to hang around. Its quiet and yet has a buzz. The location is great given a short walk to the subway, restaurants and shopping of CAuseway Bay.
reviews.title: Home in a hotel!

likes.disliked: — Lack of choice of food and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is located just across the road from Regal Hong Kong where the airport shuttle stops so it is very convenient. We were in a Grand Luxe room which was very comfortable, modern and had a well thought layout. There was also a basket which contained 1 box of free local biscuits and free drinks( 2 bottles of mineral water & 2 bottles of juice). The mineral water was replenished daily. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay. The only complain was that the single ash tray provided in the room was although stylish but ridiculously small. Perhaps more & bigger ash trays could be practical.
reviews.title: Lived Up To Its Ranking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at Lason Place for around 4 nights and loved it becuase:
reviews.title: Highly recommended - small boutique hotel, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Very personalised service
reviews.title: Interesting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. didn't feel like a big chain hotel - small and personable
reviews.title: Small Luxury Hotel?????????

description: Lanson Place luxury hotel in Hong Kong combines elegance, style and convenience in equal measure. The boutique hotel of 194 rooms, each with a kitchenette, and penthouse suites, is tucked discreetly in Hong Kong’s thriving Causeway Bay entertainment and shopping hub. A member of “Small Luxury Hotels of the World”, the Hotel is a haven from the modern metropolis outside with an elegant lounge and cocktail bar, exercise room and full business services. The concierge services are unrivalled.
